pullrequest.title: Change sleep time larger than resolution message from gzerr to gzlog

content.raw:
See the discussion in [#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2351/gazebo-issues-on-windows-subsystem-for](#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2351/gazebo-issues-on-windows-subsystem-for) .

On my machine, this message is printed approximatly 4 or 5 times per second when running Gazebo on WSL. This creates a huge problem if a user needs to check any other output printed for exaple by a plugin.

Consistently with ign-common \(see [https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/46/port-time-formattedstring-from-gazebo/diff](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/46/port-time-formattedstring-from-gazebo/diff)\) the issue is fixed by changing the output from `gzwrn` \(that is printed on the console\) to `gzlog` \(that is just saved in the log files\).
content.html:
See the discussion in #!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2351/gazebo-issues-on-windows-subsystem-for .

On my machine, this message is printed approximatly 4 or 5 times per second when running Gazebo on WSL. This creates a huge problem if a user needs to check any other output printed for exaple by a plugin.

Consistently with ign-common (see https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/46/port-time-formattedstring-from-gazebo/diff) the issue is fixed by changing the output from gzwrn (that is printed on the console) to gzlog (that is just saved in the log files).
